Activity: Log in, check emails. Relax, grab a cup of tea and biscuits.
Refine the audio mix based on yesterday's testing. Use EQ, compression, and other audio effects to create a more polished and professional sound.

Implement basic occlusion and obstruction effects to simulate how sound changes when it travels through different materials and around obstacles. (If the engine supports it and the level design allows)
Test the occlusion and obstruction effects in different areas of the level. Adjust the parameters to achieve a realistic and believable sound.

Meet with @QTEST-1 (QA Tester) @PEOPLE to get formal feedback on the overall audio experience. Provide a build with the latest audio implementations and ask for specific feedback on clarity, balance, and immersion.
Document the audio implementation process, including details on the sound assets used, the parameters adjusted, and any challenges encountered. Update the sound effects list as needed.
Review all tasks completed this week and plan for next week's audio goals. Consider the feedback received from the QA tester and prioritize addressing any major issues.
Send a summary email to @PROD-1 (Producer) @PEOPLE outlining the audio progress made this week, the challenges encountered, and the plan for next week.
